headline: Final day at MVH for Ohio National Guard
author: Allison Gens
sentences:
“The amount of gratitude we have for all the men and women that have supported out community and our clinical teams for the past two months has been tremendous.”
At the Miami Valley Hospital, guard members provided support through environmental services, food service patient transport and the Premier Health COVID-19 testing site across from the hospital.

“We have to be able to gradually migrate in there, and as we’ve seen disease activity begin to steadily decline, and that has been sustained, now is really the time we are going to be seeing some of those changes coming over the next few weeks.”

“The number of people being hospitalized is much, much less, so that’s a great thing as well, we hope those numbers continue, but we’re cautiously optimistic that we do see a trend of those numbers going down,” Suffoletto said.
Ohio Governor Mike DeWine deployed members of the Ohio National Guard to Ohio hospitals and medical centers in late December to assist with the COVID-19 surge.
Public Health – Dayton & Montgomery County public information supervisor Dan Suffoletto said the urgent need for help at the hospitals is subsiding.
While all of this is encouraging, Colon said it’s still going to take time for the hospitals, and life, to return to normal operations.
DAYTON, Ohio (WDTN) – Tuesday is the last day of the Ohio National Guard’s deployment at the Miami Valley Hospital.
According to Premier Health, February 22 is the last day of deployment for members of the Ohio National Guard.
“We can’t say thank you enough,” Miami Valley Hospital chief medical officer Dr. Roberto Colon said.
“You can’t just flip a switch and all of a sudden it’s pretending nothing happened,” Colon said.
